member.summary:
Simple helper class that prepares a cache with all bones and their matching animation variable names. Reads animation controller variable storage and looks for weight adjustments made by the animation state machines.
Designers can utilize this tool by creating a variable assignment in AnimationControllerPlugin for VRageEditor on per node basis. This lets them control the weight and blending time of animation and ragdoll layer.
USAGE: rd_weight_BONE_NAME : bone specific weight setting. rd_blend_time_BONE_NAME : bone specific blend time setting.
rd_weight_LAYER_NAME : sets weights for all non masked bones inside the layer. rd_blend_time_LAYER_NAME : sets blend times for all non masked bones inside the layer.
rd_default_blend_time : sets the default blend time value.
The specific setting is used when provided instead of the layer setting. Any variable with value lesser than 0 will be ignored.

member.name: T:Sandbox.Engine.Utils.MyConfig
member.summary: This class encapsulated read/write access to our config file - xxx.cfg - stored in user's local files It assumes that config file may be non existing, or that some values may be missing or in wrong format - this class can handle it and in such case will offer default values -> BUT YOU HAVE TO HELP IT... HOW? -> when writing getter from a new property, you have to return default value in case it's null or empty or invalid!! IMPORTANT: Never call get/set on this class properties from real-time code (during gameplay), e.g. don't do AddCue2D(cueEnum, MyConfig.VolumeMusic) IMPORTANT: Only from loading and initialization methods.

members.member: Given a position in 3D space find which face of cubemap it falls on.
Given a position in 3D space find the direction of the face of cubemap it falls on.
Compute that starting position of a row in the heightmap.

Scan pruning tree for intersection with a bounding box.
This method is a iterative implementation of the following algorithm:
procedure scan(level, box, result) for each $cell in $level $inter = intersects($cell, $box)
if $inter = INTERSECTS and $cell is not contained and $level != 0 $inter = scan($level -1, box, $result)
switch on $inter case INTERSECTS return INTERSECTS
case CONTAINED if $result == DISJOINT return INTERSECTS $result = CONTAINED
case DISJOINT if $result == CONTAINED return INTERSECTS $result = DISJOINT return $result

Query a line over the heightmap for intersection.
The line is the segment that starts in 'from' and ends in 'to'
'xy' components of the vectors are the texture coordinates. The 'z' component is the height in [0,1] range.
If either height is above or bellow the plane more than int16.MaxValue units this algorithm may yield incorrect results.

Textures used for tilesets (tiled texture joints maps).
Each texture contains a set of tiles or cells, one for each combination of same textured cells in the corners of a square.
This system allows for fast blending of textures on grid vertices.

Cell coordinates indexed by cell corner values
Corners are assigned to bits which index into the array bits: tl tr bl br

member.summary: Creates shape provider for size measuring, no textures used

members.member:
Coefficient cache.
Bicubic sampling is computationally expensive because of the many floating point operations involved (mostly matrix multiplications which are 64 muls and 48 adds). To optimize that we cache the coefficients matrix (Gz) since it is re-used multiple times with different steps.
Additionally we also compute bounds for each pixel based on the conversion from CR to Bézier control points (using the property that Bz curves lie within the convex hull of the controll points).
Further we have performance tracking for this cache (via ::CacheStats).

The cache does not store in it's cells which map does one cell belong to, so before using it we have to invalidate all entries.
Maybe at some point we can come up with a more elegant solution for multiple planets.
Calculate cell for the coefficient cache.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Engine.Voxels.Planet.MyPlanetShapeProvider.SampleHeightBicubic(System.Single,System.Single,VRageMath.Matrix@,VRageMath.Vector3@)
member.summary:
Catmull-Rom Patch:
Given a matrix of points C = [(a0, a1, a2, a3), (a4, a5, a6, a7), (a8, a9, a10, a11), (a12, a13, a14, a15)] where each a_i is a controll point with coordinates (x,y,z). The patch is then parametrized by steps s and t.
We can divide the operation into per dimension operations using the coordinate matrices Cx, Cy, Cz.
For any given s and t the position on the curve is given by S * CR * C * CRt * T, where CR is the catmull-rom coefficient matrix, CRt is the transpose of the coefficient matrix and S = (1, s, s^2, s^3), T = (1, t, t^2, t^3), s and t are of course the surface parameters.
Frequently the matrix CR * C * CRT is called G, and it's submatrices Gx, Gy, Gz.
When the controll points are in a regular grid we can map s and t to x and y. In that case we can eliminate the Gx and Gy matrices, as their interpolations would produce the same s and t values that are input.
Therefore we can calculate the height using only Gz and the normal using Gz and the scale of the grid.
Notice that the difference between this method and Bézier or B-Spline is simply the coefficient matrix.
Also the CR matrix is parameterizable, we use the centripetal form (a = .5). This form provides the best smoothing for our needs.

member.name: T:Sandbox.Engine.Voxels.MyCsgBox
member.summary:
Creates simple axis aligned box with no noise applied to it. Meant to be simple example of how to implement CSG shape.
NOTE: Using this box might not always produce sharp edges due to rasterization of distance function. They will be sharp when box aligns with raster grid (which is, simply put, for positions and sizes that are power of two).

member.name: T:Sandbox.Engine.Voxels.MyCsgShapeBase
member.summary:
Shape used in CSG operations in MyCompositeShapeProvider. It can provide signed distance from the surface of the shape as culling if this signed distance will not be within certain range of the surface given a query range. For simple implementation, see MyCsgBox.
For information on signed distance of some simple shapes go to http://www.iquilezles.org/www/articles/distfunctions/distfunctions.htm . In general, signed distance is distance to the closest point on the surface of the shape, with sign depending on whether it is outside (positive) or inside (negative). You can think of it as a step parameter for raymarching which determines how far and in which direction (forward +, backward -) you can move before hitting surface along the normalized ray direction from sampled point, assuming the origin is outside the shape.

member.name: T:Sandbox.Game.AI.Pathfinding.IMyDestinationShape
member.summary: A shape describing the destination of a pathfinding query. It is abstracted like this, so that the destination for an agent can be anything from a simple point to the space inside a building or a perimeter around an object.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.AI.Pathfinding.IMyDestinationShape.SetRelativeTransform(VRageMath.MatrixD)
member.summary: Should set the relative transform (matrix, relative vector or whatever is needed) from the world position. This will then allow the shape to be updated using UpdateWorldTransform.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.AI.Pathfinding.IMyDestinationShape.UpdateWorldTransform(VRageMath.MatrixD)
member.summary: Should update world transform of this shape from the transform previously saved by SetRelativeTransform

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.AI.Pathfinding.IMyDestinationShape.PointAdmissibility(VRageMath.Vector3D,System.Single)
member.summary: Should return the distance of the given point from the ideal position in the destination shape. If the point is outside of the destination shape, PositiveInfinity should be returned. Tolerance can be provided to allow points that lie further from the shape.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.AI.Pathfinding.IMyDestinationShape.GetClosestPoint(VRageMath.Vector3D)
member.summary: Returns the point from the shape that is closest to the query point

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.AI.Pathfinding.IMyDestinationShape.GetBestPoint(VRageMath.Vector3D)
member.summary:
Returns the ideal point towards the pathfinding should steer when starting from the query point. The difference between GetClosestPoint and this method can be shown on an example of a sphere shape: For outside points, GetClosestPoint will return points on the sphere's surface, whereas this method will always return the center of the sphere.
Note that for more complicated shapes (e.g. donut), this method returns different point that GetCenter.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.AI.Pathfinding.IMyDestinationShape.GetDestination
member.summary: Returns center of the shape for pathfinding heuristics

member.name: T:Sandbox.Game.AI.Pathfinding.IMyHighLevelComponent
member.summary:
This class contains information about the high-level components of a navigation group.
High-level navigation groups should not know about the implementation of their low-level counterparts, so this is done as an interface that the specific navigation groups can implement as they see fit.

member.name: T:Sandbox.Game.AI.Pathfinding.IMyPath
member.summary: An interface for describing a path for an agent It can be used by the bot navigation to steer the bot along a path, regardless of the underlying pathfinding implementation. This is what you should return from a pathfinding system to abstract away the implementation details of that system.

member.name: P:Sandbox.Game.AI.Pathfinding.IMyPath.EndEntity
member.summary: Entity towards which the path is going

member.name: P:Sandbox.Game.AI.Pathfinding.IMyPath.IsValid
member.summary: Says, whether the path is in a valid and consistent state. As an example, a path can be invalid when no path could be found or when the underlying data structures changed while using the path

member.param: Next target for the agent to go to
Destination radius allowing some tolerance for steering
If the target is relative to an entity, the entity will be returned in this argument (currently unused).

member.summary: Re-initializes the path, starting from the given position. The target stays the same. The purpose of this is to try to move towards the goal again if PathCompleted returns true, but the target moved while going towards it.
member.param: The current position from which we want the pathfinding to be performed

member.name: T:Sandbox.Game.AI.Pathfinding.Obsolete.MyNavmeshComponents
member.summary:
A helper class to store mapping from triangles (represented by their int index) to components (represented by their int index) and cells (ulong), given following conditions:
a) Each triangle belongs to a cell, which is assigned a ulong coordinate, and to a component b) A component cannot span more cells - that is, if two triangles are in the same component, they must also be in the same cell

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.Entities.Cube.MyTerminalBlock.CreateTerminalControls
member.summary:
Control creation was moved from the static ctor into this static function. Control creation should still be static, but static ctors only ever get called once, which means we can never modify these controls (remove), since they will be removed forever. All classes that inherit MyTerminalBlock should put terminal control creation in a function called CreateTerminalControls, as MyTerminalControlFactory will properly ensure their base classes' controls are added in. I can't make this virtual because terminal controls don't deal with instances directly (this should probably change)
GR: Had to change this from static due to parallelization issues with multuple threads. Now it should run only once.

member.summary: Returns true if this block can connect to another block (of the given type) in the given position. This is called only if CheckConnectionAllowed == true. If this method would return true for any position, set CheckConnectionAllowed to false to avoid unnecessary overhead. It is the block's responsibility to call CubeGrid.UpdateBlockNeighbors every time the conditions that are checked by this method change.

member.summary: Whether connection is allowed to any of the positions between otherBlockMinPos and otherBlockMaxPos (both inclusive). Default implementation calls ConnectionAllowed(ref Vector3I otherBlockPos, ref Vector3I faceNormal) in a for loop. Override this in a subclass if this is not needed (for example, because all calls would return the same value for the same face)

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.GameSystems.MyGridConveyorSystem.RecomputeConveyorEndpoints
member.summary: Starts the conveyor endpoint mapping re-computation, aborts the current process if needed.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.GameSystems.MyGridConveyorSystem.StartRecomputationThread
member.summary: Starts the conveyor endpoint mapping re-computation.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.GameSystems.MyGridConveyorSystem.UpdateConveyorEndpointMapping
member.summary:
Computes the conveyor endpoint mappings. The conveyor endpoint blocks come from m_conveyorEndpointBlocks, and are processed iteratively. It does not process all of them at once, it processes them until the task has been running longer than MAX_RECOMPUTE_DURATION_MILLISECONDS If it exceeds this time, it will exit and restart itself the next frame.
The task can also be aborted, when it is aborted, it will throw away all intermediate data and restart.
Accessing the grid conveyor system will be slow until this has finished computing, after which a large performance gain should be had.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.GameSystems.MyGridConveyorSystem.OnConveyorEndpointMappingUpdateCompleted
member.summary: Called when the computation finishes. If it was aborted, restarts with a clean slate. Otherwise, adds the results of the computation to the main thread accessible connections map. Will continue the task if it was interrupted by timeout.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MyCoreTexts.CrashScreen_Detail
member.summary: To help us resolve the problem, please provide a description of what you were doing when it occurred (optional):

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MyCoreTexts.CrashScreen_EmailText
member.summary: Additionally, you can send us your email in case a member of our support staff needs more information about this error. By sending the log, I grant my consent to the processing of my personal data (E-mail, {0} ID and IP address) to Keen SWH LTD. United Kingdom and it subsidiaries, in order for these data to be processed for the purpose of tracking the crash and requesting feedback with the intent to improve the game performance. I grant this consent for an indefinite term until my express revocation thereof. I confirm that I have been informed that the provision of these data is voluntary, and that I have the right to request their deletion. Registration is non-transferable. More information about the processing of my personal data in the scope required by legal regulations, in particular Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council, can be found as of 25 May 2018 here.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.BriefingTutorial01Movements
member.summary: Learn movement essentials, how to keep your engineer alive with life support energy and oxygen and how to use each of the character tools, the welder, grinder and hand drill.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.BriefingTutorial02Inventory
member.summary: An introduction to player and cargo inventories, how to add/withdraw items and a basic initiation to control panels and terminals for controlling block functions.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.BriefingTutorial03Energy
member.summary: Learn how to recharge your suit energy by tackling a series of small challenges that explain the behaviour of power within Space Engineers and the different ways you can provide it.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.BriefingTutorial04Oxygen
member.summary: This tutorial covers the various oxygen related blocks, oxygen farms, generators, vents, bottles, tanks and ice, including their control panel functions. The concept of creating an airtight room for pressurization is also addressed.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.BriefingTutorial05OreRefining
member.summary: The basics of infrastructure and industry are taught in this tutorial. You will learn how to mine ores, process them in a refinery and then commission new block components to be made in the assembler from the refined elements.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.BriefingTutorial06Conveyors
member.summary: Setting up a good conveyor system is very useful and can save you a lot of time. Learn how to move items through conveyors and the different ways to have separate systems interact or connect with each other.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.BriefingTutorial07Jetpack
member.summary: The jetpack tutorial displays the controls needed for flight which is followed by a series of assault course style sections to challenge your ability to fly quickly and accurately, you have a limited time from the moment you begin each section to reach the exit door. Watch out for hazards!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.BriefingTutorial08YourFirstShip
member.summary: The true test of any engineer is the ability to build a space-worthy ship from scratch, this tutorial will provide instruction on how to build a simple one-person transport vessel. Learn how to place blocks, weld them to completion and make a simple flight, you will also be taught essential rules of ship building that you can apply to create your own designs.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.BriefingTutorial09ShipFlight
member.summary: This tutorial offers instruction on how to fly a ship and use the three ship tools. You must use each ship in turn to navigate through several chambers that demonstrate how to grind, weld and drill as well as how to stock a weld ships cargo and how to dock with connectors.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.BriefingTutorial10Grids
member.summary: This tutorial aims to illuminate the nature of small, large and station grids, the rules that govern them and how you can join them with the merge block. There is also a brief section on floating objects.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.DefinitionError_BlockWithComputerNotTerminalBlock
member.summary: Definition for {0} contains computer, but the block's TypeId is not a terminal block. This means that the block can be owned, but the ownership cannot be changed via terminal. Hint: Try setting the TypeId to any block that is in the terminal - the simplest case being just TerminalBlock

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.DeleteBlueprintQuestion
member.summary: Are you sure you want to delete this blueprint?

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Welder
member.summary: A tool for building and repairing. Hold {CONTROL:ABASE:PRIMARY_TOOL_ACTION} to weld. Press {CONTROL:ABASE:SECONDARY_TOOL_ACTION} to put missing components to Build Planner.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_AngleGrinder
member.summary: A tool for deconstructing and salvaging. Hold {CONTROL:ABASE:PRIMARY_TOOL_ACTION} to grind.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_HandDrill
member.summary: A tool to break down rock to collect minerals. Hold down {CONTROL:ABASE:PRIMARY_TOOL_ACTION} to drill. Hold {CONTROL:ABASE:SECONDARY_TOOL_ACTION} to quickly dig tunnels.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Rifle
member.summary: The MR-20 is a staple of both military and police forces. An exceptionally reliable rifle. Easy to use, easy to clean.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_LightArmor
member.summary: Basic armor to give structure and shape to ships and stations. Not very durable but lightweight.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_HeavyArmor
member.summary: Heavy armor to give structure and shape to ships and stations. Durable but heavy.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_AdvancedRotor
member.summary: Advanced rotors enable connected grids to rotate with the ability to transfer items between the grids.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_AdvancedRotorPart
member.summary: The top part of an advanced rotor can be reattached to the rotor by accessing rotor settings.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_AirVent
member.summary: The Airvent can fill a sealed room with oxygen or extract oxygen from the atmosphere. Oxygen is produced from ice in a O2/H2 generator or by oxygen farms. Use an oxygen tank for storage and conveyors to connect the blocks.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_RadioAntenna
member.summary: Antennas can be used to broadcast positions, messages HUD markers and allows grids to be accessed or controlled from a distance. Antennas need to be able to send and receive, so make sure two antennas always overlap each other's position.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_VirtualMass
member.summary: Artificial mass or spaceballs enable grids to react to artificial gravity.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Assembler
member.summary: Assemblers are highly advanced machines capable of producing tools and components. Requires ingots and power to produce components.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_AssemblerBasic
member.summary: A basic assembler to produce a limited selection of components. Requires ingots and power to produce components.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_AtmosphericThrust
member.summary: Atmospheric thrusters can only function in planetary atmospheres.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Battery
member.summary: A battery stores power and is able to distribute a high output of energy.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Beacon
member.summary: A beacon is used to broadcast its position.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_ButtonPanel
member.summary: Button panels enable you to bind block functions to buttons that can be directly interacted with. When highlighted, press {CONTROL:TERMINAL} to configure the buttons and {CONTROL:USE} to activate them.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Camera
member.summary: The camera allows you to view remote locations and zoom in on distant objects. Set up cameras on ship toolbars so you can zoom while using weapons or look behind you while docking.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_SmallCargoContainer
member.summary: Small containers can be used to store items.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_MediumCargoContainer
member.summary: Medium containers can be used to store items.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_LargeCargoContainer
member.summary: Large containers can be used to store many items.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_SteelCatwalk
member.summary: Catwalks can be used to build walkways or function as thin walls.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Cockpit
member.summary: Cockpits are used to control your ship. Connect a cockpit with oxygen tanks and O2/H2 generators to supply the cockpit with oxygen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FighterCockpit
member.summary: Fighter cockpits are used to control ships and offer a little more protection than normal cockpits. Connect the cockpit with Oxygen tanks and O2/H2 generators to supply the cockpit with oxygen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Collector
member.summary: Collectors collects items when they get close to the collector's funnel.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Connector
member.summary: The connector can be magnetically locked with other connectors to allow cross grid distribution of items and power. Toggle the magnetic lock from your toolbar or press {CONTROL:LANDING_GEAR}. Connectors will show up yellow when in range. Unlocking it will briefly disable the magnetic function.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_ControlPanel
member.summary: Control panels are simple panels that allow access to grid menus. When highlighted, press {CONTROL:TERMINAL} to interact with the panel.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_ControlStation
member.summary: Control stations are used to control a large ship.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Descripton_ConveyorJunction
member.summary: Use conveyor tubes and junctions to connect inventories of blocks so that items and gases can move freely from one inventory to another.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_ConveyorSorter
member.summary: Conveyor sorters can be configured to only pass specific items through or stop specific items from passing through. Sorters can be used to filter out unwanted materials or to collect specific items in a container.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_ConveyorTube
member.summary: Use conveyor tubes and junctions to connect inventories of blocks so that items can move freely from one inventory to another.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_CornerLight
member.summary: Lights are used to illuminate interiors or can be used to act as reference points on exteriors.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_CryoChamber
member.summary: Cryo rooms can store players while they are disconnected from a server. Reduced oxygen consumption for player. Stores toolbar while offline. Connect the cryo room with Oxygen tanks, O2/H2 generators or oxygen farms with conveyors to supply oxygen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Decoy
member.summary: Decoys attract fire from enemy turrets and protect your property from lightning strikes.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Door
member.summary: Doors can seal off interiors and make them air tight while still allowing access for the player.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Drill
member.summary: Ship drills are utility tools for mining on planets or asteroids to collect raw ores. Can be used from a cockpit or turned on manually. Be careful not to get too close while it's active. Use conveyors to connect the drill with more storage blocks or refineries.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Ejector
member.summary: The ejector allows small items to be ejected from small ships. Can also be used to access inventories. You can use the ejector together with the conveyor sorter to collect and throw out specific items.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FlightSeat
member.summary: Flight seats are used to control a large ship and access all of its functions.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FullCoverWall
member.summary: Armored walls provide cover in interiors or can be used to prevent players from walking off ledges.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_GatlingGun
member.summary: Fast-shooting gun that can be loaded through conveyors. Uses Gatling Ammo Boxes. Maximum range: 800 m

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_GatlingTurret
member.summary: Fast-shooting turret that can be loaded through conveyors. Uses Gatling Ammo Boxes. Maximum range: 800 m

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_GravityGenerator
member.summary: Gravity generators create configurable artificial gravity fields that affect players and items in an otherwise zero G environment. Has diminishing effects when inside a real gravity field.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_GravityGeneratorSphere
member.summary: Spherical gravity generators create a configurable artificial spherical gravity field that affects players and items in an otherwise zero G environment. Has diminishing effects when inside a real gravity field.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_ShipGrinder
member.summary: Ship grinders are utility tools for deconstructing grids. Can be used from a cockpit or turned on manually. Be careful not to get too close while it's active.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Gyroscope
member.summary: Gyroscopes allow ships to orientate using the mouse movements and stabilize rotating grids. Build more gyroscopes to increase sensitivity and the speed that a grid can turn.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_HangarDoor
member.summary: Hangar doors can be linked together to create large gates that can seal spaces air tight while allowing vehicles in and out. You can build and use a button panel to open hangar doors by interacting with it or sensors to make them open and close automatically.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_HydrogenTank
member.summary: Hydrogen tanks are used for storing hydrogen fuel. Hydrogen is used for hydrogen thrusters, engines or jetpack fuel. Hydrogen can be produced from ice in a O2/H2 generator. Can store and refill hydrogen bottles.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_HydrogenThrust
member.summary: Hydrogen thrusters are powerful thrusters that consume hydrogen and function in every environment. Hydrogen can be produced from ice in a O2/H2 generator. Use a hydrogen tank for storage. Use Conveyors to transport the hydrogen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_InteriorLight
member.summary: Lights are used to illuminate interiors or can be used to act as reference points on exteriors.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_InteriorPillar
member.summary: Pillars and columns can be used to reinforce structures or as decoration.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_InteriorTurret
member.summary: Autonomous anti-personnel turret. Must be manually loaded with MR-50A magazines. Maximum range: 600 m

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_InteriorWall
member.summary: Interior walls are blocks with emissive lights to function as interior walls, ceilings or floors.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_IonThrust
member.summary: Ion thrusters are advanced thrusters that function best in zero gravity environments.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_JumpDrive
member.summary: Jump drives allow ships to teleport over large distances. They require a full charge to jump and can only be activated from the toolbar of a cockpit.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_TextPanel
member.summary: LCD panels display pictograms or customized text.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_LandingGear
member.summary: Landing gears and Magnetic Plates are capable of magnetically locking to any surface. They can be locked and unlocked by pressing {CONTROL:SPACESHIP:LANDING_GEAR} when inside a cockpit. They will show up yellow when in range of a surface that they can lock onto.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_LaserAntenna
member.summary: Laser antennas do not broadcast a signal that other players can see but instead require direct line of sight to function. This antenna is connected by using GPS coordinates.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_MedicalRoom
member.summary: The Medical room enables you to respawn, change your appearance and recharge your health and energy much faster than the survival kit.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_MergeBlock
member.summary: Merge blocks can be used to permanently or temporarily connect two grids together and function as one grid. Merge blocks will show up yellow when in range of another merge block.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_MissileTurret
member.summary: Slow-shooting, explosive damage dealing, missile launcher that can be loaded through conveyors. Uses Missiles. Maximum range: 800 m

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_ProductivityModule
member.summary: Speed modules increase the production speed of refineries or assemblers when connected.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_EffectivenessModule
member.summary: Yield modules increase production yield of refineries when connected.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_PowerEfficiencyModule
member.summary: Power modules decrease power consumption of refineries or assemblers when connected.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_OreDetector
member.summary: Ore detectors detect ores within a limited radius and makes them show up on your HUD.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_OxygenFarm
member.summary: Hydroponics farms produce small amounts of oxygen when in contact with sunlight. Use an oxygen tank to store oxygen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_OxygenGenerator
member.summary: O2/H2 generators produce oxygen and hydrogen from ice. Use oxygen and hydrogen tanks for storage. Will refill bottles automatically.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_OxygenTank
member.summary: Oxygen tank store oxygen. Able to store and refill oxygen bottles. Use O2/H2 generator to produce oxygen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_ParachuteHatch
member.summary: Parachute hatches deploy parachutes to slow down the descent of ships when inside the atmosphere. Can be configured to open automatically or used manually from the toolbar or settings.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Passage
member.summary: Passages allow passage either vertically or horizontally.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_PassengerSeat
member.summary: A passenger seat can be used to transport other players.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Piston
member.summary: The piston is an expandable block that allows the transfer of power and items.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_PistonTop
member.summary: This piston part is the top section of the piston. It has no function of its own, but can be used decoratively.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_ProgrammableBlock
member.summary: A Programmable Block is a computer that runs scripts to manage ship systems. Scripts can be found on the Workshop or written manually.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Projector
member.summary: The projector block projects saved blueprints of ships so that they can be built easily. Projection requires a connection with a grid from a projector in order to start construction.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Ramp
member.summary: The ramp block can be used to traverse heights or simply used for aesthetics.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Reactor
member.summary: Reactors generate high amounts of power at the cost of refined uranium ingots. Uranium is one of the rarest elements and cannot be found on planets. Uranium can be found in asteroids, and in some craters left by meteorite impacts.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Refinery
member.summary: Advanced refineries refine all ores into ingots. They can be upgraded with upgrade modules.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_RefineryBasic
member.summary: Basic refineries refines limited types of ores into ingots.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_RocketLauncherReload
member.summary: An advanced version of the rocket launcher, capable of using the conveyor system to automatically reload. Uses Missiles. Maximum range: 800 m

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_RemoteControl
member.summary: Remote controls allow ships to be controlled from a distance when combined with an antenna or commands ships to fly automatically to waypoints.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_RocketLauncher
member.summary: Slow-shooting, explosive damage dealing, rocket launcher that must be loaded manually. Uses Missiles. Maximum range: 800 m

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Rotor
member.summary: Rotors allows connected grids to rotate.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_RotorPart
member.summary: The rotor part is the top section of the rotor. It can be reattached with a rotor within rotor settings.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Sensor
member.summary: Sensors can be set up to activate ship systems when they detects players, ships or asteroids within a limited range.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_SolarPanel
member.summary: Solar panels generate power when exposed to sunlight. Point solar panels directly at the sun to improve the amount of power generated.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Sound
member.summary: Sound blocks emit sounds when activated.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_SpaceBall
member.summary: A spherical block that reacts to gravity.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_ReflectorLight
member.summary: Spotlights are powerful lights used to illuminate dark areas.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Stairs
member.summary: Stairs can be used to traverse heights.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Timer
member.summary: Timer blocks can be used to activate configured ship systems after a set amount of time. Use multiple timer blocks to build sequences. Can be used to automate systems.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Warhead
member.summary: Warheads are powerful explosives that can be used to destroy asteroids, enemy ships and stations. Safe when unarmed. They can be detonated manually, by taking damage or set to detonate after a configurable amount of time.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_ShipWelder
member.summary: A Ship welder is a utility tool that can construct blueprints and blocks using components from its inventory. Can be used from a cockpit or turned on manually. Be careful not to get too close while it's active. Press RMB to put missing components to Build Planner.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Wheel
member.summary: Wheels can be used to traverse terrain in environments with gravity.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Suspension
member.summary: Suspensions are highly durable and enable vehicles to drive over most terrains.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Window
member.summary: Transparent windows will keep the air in and space out while you enjoy the view.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_VerticalWindow
member.summary: Vertical windows can be used to funnel air through and keep engineers out.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_DiagonalWindow
member.summary: Diagonal window shutters can be used as stairs.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_SurvivalKit
member.summary: All in one factory to get a space engineer started, but it has limited refining and assembling capabilities. Allows the player to recharge.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_WindTurbine
member.summary: The Wind turbine generates low amounts of power when exposed to open areas. Only works on planets with atmosphere.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_PowerGenerator
member.summary: The hydrogen engine converts hydrogen into power and has its own internal hydrogen tank.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Ladder
member.summary: The ladder enables you to traverse vertical spaces.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Desk
member.summary: A desk for decorating interiors. Can be used as a seat.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_DeskCorner
member.summary: A desk for decorating interiors. Can be used as a seat.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FoodDispenser
member.summary: A vending machine used to distract engineers from the hazards of space and boost morale.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Jukebox
member.summary: A device that plays music. Great for hosting dance parties or winding down after a hard day’s work.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_OpenCockpitLarge
member.summary: Seat in between lots of consoles. More like a bridge seat.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_OpenCockpitSmall
member.summary: This control seat can be used to pilot anything from modest rovers to small-scale ships; they're also exceptionally comfortable.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_LabEquipment
member.summary: Whether you’re conducting experiments or you simply want to look smart, lab equipment is perfect for decorating interiors.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Shower
member.summary: A shower for decorating interiors and an ideal place to practice singing. Show everyone you care about hygiene.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_WindowWall
member.summary: Transparent windows will keep the air inside and space outside while you enjoy the view in style.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_WindowWallLeft
member.summary: Transparent windows will keep the air inside and space outside while you enjoy the view in style.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_WindowWallRight
member.summary: Transparent windows will keep the air inside and space outside while you enjoy the view in style.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_MedicalStation
member.summary: A decorative station that allows engineers to examine their injuries.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_TransparentLCD
member.summary: Transparent LCD panels display pictograms, scripts or customized text.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_RailingStraight
member.summary: Railings stop engineers from falling off dangerous ledges. Safety first!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_RailingDouble
member.summary: Railings stop engineers from falling off dangerous ledges. Safety first!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_RailingCorner
member.summary: Railings stop engineers from falling off dangerous ledges. Safety first!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_RailingDiagonal
member.summary: Railings stop engineers from falling off dangerous ledges. Safety first!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_GratedCatwalk
member.summary: Catwalks can be used to create safe walkways throughout your creations.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_GratedCatwalkCorner
member.summary: Catwalks can be used to create safe walkways throughout your creations.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_GratedCatwalkStraight
member.summary: Catwalks can be used to create safe walkways throughout your creations.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_GratedCatwalkWall
member.summary: Catwalks can be used to create safe walkways throughout your creations.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_GratedStairs
member.summary: Stairs can be used to create safe walkways throughout your creations.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_GratedHalfStairs
member.summary: Stairs can be used to create safe walkways throughout your creations.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_RotatingLight
member.summary: A rotating light to alert engineers of hazardous situations.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Freight
member.summary: Crates left scattered around, indicating hard working engineers have been working in the area.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Lockers
member.summary: Personalized lockers for decorating interiors and store your essentials.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_LockerRoom
member.summary: A locker to store tools, weapons, ammunition and bottles.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_LockerRoomCorner
member.summary: A locker to store tools, weapons, ammunition and bottles.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Couch
member.summary: A couch for decorating interiors. Can be used as a seat.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_CornerCouch
member.summary: A couch for decorating interior corners. Can be used as a seat.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Bathroom
member.summary: A toilet for decorating interiors. Can be used as a seat.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_BathroomOpen
member.summary: A toilet for decorating interiors. Can be used as a seat.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_ToiletSeat
member.summary: A toilet for decorating interiors. Can be used as a seat.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Console
member.summary: A console table for decorating interiors, projecting ships and stations in custom scale, as well as displaying pictograms or customized text on its displays.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_CockpitIndustrial
member.summary: Cockpits are used to control your ship. Connect a cockpit with oxygen tanks and O2/H2 generators to supply the cockpit with oxygen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_Bed
member.summary: A bed for decorating interiors. Can preserve the players' inventory and toolbar while they're offline and keeps them alive as long as there is oxygen available in environment.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.DisplayName_Block_HeavyArmorInvCorner2BaseSmooth
member.summary: Heavy Armor Inv. Corner 2x1x1 Base Smooth

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.DisplayName_Block_HeavyArmorInvCorner2TipSmooth
member.summary: Heavy Armor Inv. Corner 2x1x1 Tip Smooth

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.DisplayName_Block_LightArmorHalfSlopeCornerInverted
member.summary: Half Slope Corner Inv. Light Armor

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.DisplayName_Block_HeavyArmorHalfSlopeCornerInverted
member.summary: Half Slope Corner Inv. Heavy Armor

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.DisplayName_Block_LightArmorHalfSlopedCornerBase
member.summary: Light Armor Half Sloped Corner Base

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.DisplayName_Block_HeavyArmorHalfSlopedCornerBase
member.summary: Heavy Armor Half Sloped Corner Base

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.DisplayName_Block_LightArmorCornerSquareInverted
member.summary: Light Armor Corner Square Inv. Block

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.DisplayName_Block_HeavyArmorCornerSquareInverted
member.summary: Heavy Armor Corner Square Inv. Block

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.DisplayName_Block_LightArmorInvCorner2BaseSmooth

member.summary: Light Armor Inv. Corner 2x1x1 Tip Smooth

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.DisplayName_BlueprintClass_BasicLargeBlocks
member.summary: Basic Large Blocks - Click on any Large Block to assemble all components necessary for it's construction.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.DisplayName_BlueprintClass_BasicSmallBlocks
member.summary: Basic Small Blocks - Click on any Small Block to assemble all components necessary for it's construction.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.GuiScenarioCannotJoin
member.summary: Scenario is already running, cannot join game.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.GuiScenarioEdit_CopyIdsTooltip
member.summary: You can then paste them into "Block destroyed" trigger

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.GuiTriggerBlockDestroyedSingleMessage
member.summary: Message after each block is destroyed

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.GuiTriggerNextMissionTooltip
member.summary: You can put a scenario name here (must already exist on local computer to be loaded) or workshop ID number (user does *not* have to have it subscribed in that case). Workshop ID can be seen in the URL link of scenario in question on {0} workshop web.

member.summary: Adds blocks copied through button at the end of block terminal screen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HelpScreen_ControllerHint1
member.summary: You can change "brush" size while recoloring with {GAMEPAD_CONTROL:COLOR_PICKER:MEDIUM_COLOR_BRUSH} and {GAMEPAD_CONTROL:COLOR_PICKER:LARGE_COLOR_BRUSH}

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HelpScreen_ControllerHint2
member.summary: You can change Saturation and Value of the selected color with {GAMEPAD:AXIS_DPAD} while recoloring.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HelpScreen_ControllerHint3
member.summary: If you make mistake while placing blocks in survival mode you can press {GAMEPAD_CONTROL:BUILD:SECONDARY_TOOL_ACTION} to switch to Grinder tool. When you have Grinder equipped you can press {GAMEPAD_CONTROL:BUILD:SECONDARY_TOOL_ACTION} again to switch to the last equipped block.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HelpScreen_ControllerHint4
member.summary: You can move through complicated windows more easily with Right Stick.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HelpScreen_ControllerHint5
member.summary: If you are building a symmetrical ship, you can activate Symmetry Building Mode through Systems Radial Menu.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HelpScreen_ControllerHint6
member.summary: You can modify voxels with Voxel Hand Tool, which can be accesed from System Radial Menu in Creative Mode. You can then place, remove, revert and paint voxels with {GAMEPAD_CONTROL:VOXEL:PRIMARY_TOOL_ACTION} , {GAMEPAD_CONTROL:VOXEL:SECONDARY_TOOL_ACTION} , {GAMEPAD_CONTROL:VOXEL:VOXEL_REVERT} and {GAMEPAD_CONTROL:VOXEL:VOXEL_PAINT} respectively.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HelpScreen_ControllerHint7
member.summary: Emotes toolbar is predefined and cannot be changed.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HelpScreen_ControllerHint8
member.summary: Most common actions on Systems Menu have shortcuts. Pros use shortcuts!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HelpScreen_ControllerHint9
member.summary: When firing a block weapon in ship that has multiple weapons of the same type you can toggle firing a single weapon or all at once with LB+LT

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HelpScreen_ControllerHint10
member.summary: When looking at inventory port with blocks in Build Planner queue, you can add components for queued blocks into production by pressing {GAMEPAD_CONTROL:CHARACTER:BUILD_PLANNER_ADD_COMPONNETS}.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint00Text
member.summary: Did you know? You can build blocks from any cockpit by pressing Ctrl-G.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HintKeyboardOnly01Text
member.summary: Did you know? You can toggle off the block auto rotation function with {0}.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HintKeyboardOnly02Text
member.summary: Did you know? Shift-{0} will directly bring you to the antenna menu.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint03Text
member.summary: You can steer vehicles from a turret if the cockpit is set to main cockpit. Hold Alt to enable mouse control.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint04Text
member.summary: Stuck? Pressing {0} enables you to respawn.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HintKeyboardOnly05Text
member.summary: Did you know? You can dig tunnels quickly without producing ore by using right mouse function with your drill.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint06Text
member.summary: A few well placed decoy blocks can make the difference between a victory and a loss.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint07Text
member.summary: Did you know? Meteor impact craters can leave valuable resources.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint08Text
member.summary: Did you know? Dark spots on planets indicate ore deposits.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint09Text
member.summary: Did you know? Rocks on the surface of planets often contain valuable resources.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint10Text
member.summary: Did you know? While driving a rover, Hold {0} to brake.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint11Text
member.summary: Be careful using your jetpack on planets. Your hydrogen fuel will run out quickly.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint12Text
member.summary: Did you know? you can open the color picker by pressing {0}.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint13Text
member.summary: Batteries will automatically charge and distribute power when necessary according to their settings.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint14Text
member.summary: Upgrade modules will improve the performance of your refineries and assemblers.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HintKeyboardOnly09Text
member.summary: You can save Creations by pressing CTRL-B. Open the blueprint menu with F10.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HintKeyboardOnly08Text
member.summary: While holding a blueprint in creative mode, you can use B to align them to a planet's Gravity.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint17Text
member.summary: Using a ship to grind down a container will also pick up whatever was inside of the container.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HintKeyboardOnly07Text
member.summary: Double clicking items will automatically transfer the whole stack between inventories.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HintKeyboardOnly06Text
member.summary: Holding Ctrl, Shift or Ctrl-Shift enables you to move stacks of items by 10, 100 and 1000 at the time.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HintKeyboardOnly04Text
member.summary: Did you know? Scrolling while using a camera or turret enables you to zoom in and out.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint21Text
member.summary: Did you know? You can manually control turrets to carefully pick off targets.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint22Text
member.summary: Did you know? Your magnetic boots only work when there is no gravity around.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HintKeyboardOnly03Text
member.summary: Did you know? Double click while wielding a tool will keep it continuously working.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint24Text
member.summary: Did you know? Warheads are perfectly safe until you arm them.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint25Text
member.summary: Did you know? O2/H2 generator can produce small amounts of hydrogen for thrusters without having a hydrogen tank involved.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.HintKeyboardOnly00Text
member.summary: Did you know? Press {0} to change the way GPS coordinates and Antennas are displayed on your HUD.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint27Text
member.summary: Did you know? Blocks that are destroyed during collisions or combat can cause damage around them.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint26Text
member.summary: Did you know? Pressurized environments will maintain optimal temperatures and recharge your health and oxygen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint23Text
member.summary: Did you know? Your suit's power drains faster when residing in cold or warm temperatures.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint20Text
member.summary: Did you know? The medical room recharges your energy and health five times as fast as the survival kit.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint19Text
member.summary: Did you know? You can use sensors to detect enemies located underground who are attempting to infiltrate your base.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint18Text
member.summary: Did you know? Wind turbines are more efficient when placed in high and open spaces.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint16Text
member.summary: Did you know? Rovers can use their wheel suspensions to jump out of tight situations.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint15Text
member.summary: Did you know? Advanced refineries give better yield when refining minerals.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint05Text
member.summary: Did you know? Your jet pack can match the velocity of nearby grids using relative dampeners.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint02Text
member.summary: Did you know? Wheel suspensions use power based on their power setting.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Hint01Text
member.summary: Did you know? You can use /f to chat with your faction only or /g for global.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Intro_Detail1
member.summary: Hello, Engineer! My name is Good.bot. I am an AI teacher that helps you by offering directions. Let's get you started! You can access useful information in the help screen.

member.summary: Your jetpack runs on hydrogen fuel. Be careful not to run out of it while flying.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.LaserAntennaReceiversListHelp
member.summary: These receivers are in radio range and can report their position. Their current state and target is in parenthesis: idle laser is idling >> laser is rotating towards other receiver or GPS coordinates ?> searching for other laser at requested GPS coordinates ~> contacting other side of link (this includes waiting for other laser to turn its face to me or futile effort to contact receiver which is turned off or is not there any more) => connection is established To connect to lasers not listed here you can connect to coordinates.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ProgrammableBlock_DefaultScript_Constructor
member.summary: The constructor, called only once every session and always before any other method is called. Use it to initialize your script. The constructor is optional and can be removed if not needed. It's recommended to set RuntimeInfo.UpdateFrequency here, which will allow your script to run itself without a timer block.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ProgrammableBlock_DefaultScript_Main
member.summary: The main entry point of the script, invoked every time one of the programmable block's Run actions are invoked, or the script updates itself. The updateSource argument describes where the update came from. The method itself is required, but the arguments above can be removed if not needed.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ProgrammableBlock_DefaultScript_Save
member.summary: Called when the program needs to save its state. Use this method to save your state to the Storage field or some other means. This method is optional and can be removed if not needed.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote00Text
member.summary: Scientists discover the world that exists; Engineers create the world that never was.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote01Text
member.summary: Scientific discovery and scientific knowledge have been achieved only by those who have gone in pursuit of it without any practical purpose whatsoever in view.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote02Text
member.summary: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote03Text
member.summary: When a distinguished but elderly scientist states that something is possible, he is almost certainly right. When he states that something is impossible, he is very probably wrong.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote04Text
member.summary: Science may set limits to knowledge, but should not set limits to imagination.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote05Text
member.summary: Nothing shocks me. I'm a scientist.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote06Text
member.summary: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote07Text
member.summary: A new scientific truth does not triumph by convincing its opponents and making them see the light, but rather because its opponents eventually die, and a new generation grows up that is familiar with it.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote08Text
member.summary: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote09Text
member.summary: Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote10Text
member.summary: Nature never breaks her own laws.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote12Text
member.summary: Where there is shouting, there is no true knowledge.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote13Text
member.summary: I have offended God and mankind because my work didn't reach the quality it should have.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote14Text
member.summary: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote15Text
member.summary: By denying scientific principles, one may maintain any paradox.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote16Text
member.summary: Mathematics is the language in which God has written the universe.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote17Text
member.summary: If I were again beginning my studies, I would follow the advice of Plato and start with mathematics.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote18Text
member.summary: We see only what we know.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote19Text
member.summary: If anybody says he can think about quantum problems without getting giddy, that only shows he has not understood the first thing about them.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote20Text
member.summary: Only one thing is certain - that is, nothing is certain. If this statement is true, it is also false.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote21Text
member.summary: Scientists are explorers. Philosophers are tourists.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote22Text
member.summary: A great pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote23Text
member.summary: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote24Text
member.summary: I know one thing: that I know nothing.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote25Text
member.summary: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote26Text
member.summary: When you want to know how things really work, study them when they're coming apart.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote27Text
member.summary: Engineers like to solve problems. If there are no problems handily available, they will create their own problems.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote28Text
member.summary: One man's "magic" is another man's engineering. "Supernatural" is a null word.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote29Text
member.summary: A good scientist is a person with original ideas. A good engineer is a person who makes a design that works with as few original ideas as possible. There are no prima donnas in engineering.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote30Text
member.summary: Aviation is the branch of engineering that is least forgiving of mistakes.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote31Text
member.summary: A space engineer is a professional practitioner who uses scientific knowledge, mathematics, physics, astronomy, propulsion technology, materials science, structural analysis, manufacturing and ingenuity to solve practical problems in space.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote32Text
member.summary: Space engineers design materials, structures, and systems while considering the limitations imposed by practicality, regulation, safety, ethicality and cost.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote33Text
member.summary: Space engineers are grounded in applied sciences, and their work in research and development is distinct from the basic research focus of space scientists.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote34Text
member.summary: In war times, space engineering involves military engineering as well. Such tasks typically include construction and demolition tasks under combat conditions.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote35Text
member.summary: Space engineers are in a high demand, especially since the Second Space Race of 2029.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote36Text
member.summary: Space engineers take pride for their ability to get the job done right - no matter how big, how complex, or how remote.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote37Text
member.summary: The word engineer is derived from the Latin roots 'ingeniare' ("to contrive, devise") and 'ingenium' ("cleverness").

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote38Text
member.summary: To the optimist, the glass is half full. To the pessimist, the glass is half empty. To the engineer, the glass is twice as big as it needs to be.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote39Text
member.summary: Scientists investigate that which already is; engineers create that which has never been.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote41Text
member.summary: If you see a bomb technician running, follow him.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote42Text
member.summary: The only time you have too much fuel is when you're on fire.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote44Text
member.summary: A pilot who doesn't have any fear probably isn't flying his plane to its maximum.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote45Text
member.summary: To an engineer, good enough means perfect. With an artist, there's no such thing as perfect.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote46Text
member.summary: Mars is there, waiting to be reached.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote47Text
member.summary: This is one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote48Text
member.summary: I see Earth! It is so beautiful!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote49Text
member.summary: I could have gone on flying through space forever.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote50Text
member.summary: To go places and do things that have never been done before - that's what living is all about.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote51Text
member.summary: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote52Text
member.summary: To be the first to enter the cosmos, to engage, single-handed, in an unprecedented duel with nature - could one dream of anything more?

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote53Text
member.summary: The path of a cosmonaut is not an easy, triumphant march to glory. You have to get to know the meaning not just of joy but also of grief, before being allowed in the spacecraft cabin.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote54Text
member.summary: The dreams of yesterday are the hopes of today and the reality of tomorrow.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote56Text
member.summary: No amount of experimentation can ever prove me right; a single experiment can prove me wrong.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote57Text
member.summary: Science never solves a problem without creating ten more.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote58Text
member.summary: The law of conservation of energy states that energy can be neither created nor destroyed. However, energy can change forms, and energy can flow from one place to another. The total energy of an isolated system remains the same.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote59Text
member.summary: The flow of heat is a form of energy transfer. In other words, a quantity of heat that flows from a hot body to a cold one can be expressed as an amount of energy being transferred from the hot body to the cold one.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote60Text
member.summary: Every body persists in its state of being at rest or of moving uniformly straight forward, except insofar as it is compelled to change its state by force impressed.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote61Text
member.summary: An object that is at rest will stay at rest unless an external force acts upon it.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote62Text
member.summary: An object that is in motion will not change its velocity unless an external force acts upon it.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote63Text
member.summary: The acceleration of a body is directly proportional to, and in the same direction as, the net force acting on the body, and inversely proportional to its mass.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote64Text
member.summary: To every action there is always an equal and opposite reaction: or the forces of two bodies on each other are always equal and are directed in opposite directions.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote65Text
member.summary: SCIENTIFIC METHOD: principles and procedures for the systematic pursuit of knowledge involving the recognition and formulation of a problem, the collection of data through observation and experiment, and the formulation and testing of hypotheses.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote66Text
member.summary: To be termed scientific, a method of inquiry must be based on empirical and measurable evidence subject to specific principles of reasoning.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote67Text
member.summary: The laws of science or scientific laws are statements that describe, predict, and perhaps explain why, a range of phenomena behave as they appear to in nature.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote68Text
member.summary: Scientific laws are strongly supported by empirical evidence - they are scientific knowledge that experiments have repeatedly verified (and never falsified).

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Quote69Text
member.summary: Every point mass in the universe attracts every other point mass with a force that is directly proportional to the product of their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.RemoteAccess_Description
member.summary: You can remotely access grids in the world using the antenna in your suit. Make sure your antenna is enabled. (Check the antenna symbol in the bottom left corner of the in-game HUD) To access a grid, it must be powered and have an antenna. You also need to stay within the antenna broadcast range to be able to access it. You can control grids from a distance by equipping them with a remote control block.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.TerminalTab_Info_ConvertToStationButton_TT

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.TerminalTab_Info_Description
member.summary: Building a grid partially inside of terrain automatically turns the grid into a station. Stations are more performance friendly but are static and cannot be moved. You can convert any station into a ship. Be careful that it's not embedded in any terrain as it might explode. A ship needs to be stationary in order to convert it into a station.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.TerminalTab_Info_DestructibleBlocks_Tooltip
