member.summary: Sets the density of procedurally generated asteroid fields.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsAutoHealing
member.summary: Enables auto-healing of players in pressurized environments while not taking any damage. It heals up to {0}%.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsDifficulty
member.summary: The damage given and taken to and from enemies and environment. Higher difficulty means more realistic damage.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsEnableCargoShips
member.summary: Whether random cargo ships should be enabled

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsEnableCopyPaste
member.summary: Copy paste allows to create new ships or stations directly from the clipboard.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsEnableSpectator
member.summary: Enables spectator view in the world.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsEnvironment
member.summary: Sets the frequency and intensity of meteor showers.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsFriendlyFire
member.summary: When checked, allies can damage each other

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsHardwareRequirements
member.summary: Hardware requirements define how rich your world can be. Higher values are more demanding on computing performance of your computer (CPU and GPU) and will definitely require more memory.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsHarvestingMode
member.summary: Creative Mode: unlimited resources, instant building, players don't die. Use creative mode when you just want to build things. Survival Mode: realistic inventory capacity, constrained resources - you have to drill and harvest ore, process it in a refinery, construct components in assembler, build blocks using welder, disassemble using grinder, players can die - they re-spawn in their spawn point and if there's no spawn point available, then in a new ship as a new player at the border of the sector. Survival x3: same as "Survival", but 3x larger inventory capacity. Survival x10: same as "Survival", but 10x larger inventory capacity.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsLimitWorldSize
member.summary: When set, the game area is limited to a cube with the side length set to the chosen size. All objects that leave the game area will be removed from the game. Characters leaving the game area will be killed.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsMaxBackupSaves
member.summary: Configure the maximum number of saves that should be backed up. The backup folder is located on the respective save directory. When this is 0 then the backup feature is disabled and all backups are deleted upon save!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsMaxBlocksPerPlayer
member.summary: Maximum number of blocks each player can build. Destroyed blocks are refunded.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsMaxFloatingObjects
member.summary: Maximum number of small objects floating in space (ore, ingots, components) Warning - values higher than 64 can significantly affect performance!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsTotalBotLimit
member.summary: Maximum number of animal NPCs on planets. Warning - values higher than 64 can significantly affect performance!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsMaxGridSize
member.summary: Sets the maximum size (in blocks) of ships and stations.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsMaxPlayer
member.summary: Sets the maximum amount of players in game.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsModeCreative
member.summary: Unlimited resources, instant building, no death

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsModeSurvival
member.summary: Realistic management of resources, realistic inventory capacity, death and respawn

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsOnlineMode
member.summary: Visibility of your game. Offline: Game runs in offline mode and does not require internet connection Private: Only invited players can join Friends: Only your {0} friends can join Public: Any {0} player can join

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsPermanentDeath
member.summary: Enables players losing everything if they die and don't have any available respawn points.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsPVP
member.summary: PvE means that you cannot damage other players. PvP means that you can damage them and they can damage you.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsRemoveTrash
member.summary: If checked, ships that are considered to be trash will be removed to make the game run faster. To be considered trash, the grid has to contain just a few blocks, be in uniform linear motion, be unpowered, uncontrolled, without a medbay and far enough from all players so that they can barely see it.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.TooltipWorldSettingsRespawnShipDelete
member.summary: Deletes respawn ships when players leave servers or spawn in new ships.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsShowPlayerNamesOnHud
member.summary: Enables player name tags above above their characters.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsSoundInSpace
member.summary: There's no sound in space. Turn it on to simulate Earth-like sound conditions (even though it's not realistic). Turn it off for a realistic mode where you can hear only sounds that your astronaut character can hear.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsSoundMode
member.summary: Switches between realistic and arcade sounds.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsThrusterDamage
member.summary: Enables thruster flames dealing damage to blocks, players, and small objects.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsTotalPCU
member.summary: Sets the total amount of performance cost units (PCU) in the world. Each placed block costs some PCU. Dismantled blocks are refunded.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsViewDistance
member.summary: Larger view distances can cause performance issues depending on how many objects are in the world. Large view distances are not recommended on worlds with high asteroid densities.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsOptimalSpawnDistance
member.summary: Optimal distance in meters the game should take into consideration when spawning new player near others.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsAutorespawn
member.summary: Enables automatic respawning at the nearest available respawn point.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettingsSupergridding
member.summary: Allows supergridding exploit to be used.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_AdaptiveSimulationQuality
member.summary: Enables quality reduction of deformations and explosions affecting voxels in case the CPU is on fire.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_AssemblerEfficiency
member.summary: Sets the assembler efficiency multiplier. This setting increases or decreases the material yield of ore.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_Assembler_x10
member.summary: Assembler requires 10x less materials and is 10x faster

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_Assembler_x3
member.summary: Assembler requires 3x less materials and is 3x faster

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_CargoShipsEnabled
member.summary: Enables random cargoships flying through the world from time to time.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_ClientCanSave
member.summary: Client can save network game. If unchecked then only server can save

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_DayDuration
member.summary: Adjusts the length of the day cycle.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_Enable3rdPersonCamera
member.summary: Enables the camera to be switchable to 3rd person view.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableConvertToStation
member.summary: Adds an option to ship terminals to convert ships to stations.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableDrones
member.summary: Random NPC pirate ship will be generated from time to time. These ships are enemies and will try to attack you with their drones.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableEncounters
member.summary: Enables randomly spawned abandoned ships and stations.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableIngameScripts
member.summary: Enables scripts running in game. Scripts are used in programmable blocks. They can also be used by some mods to create advanced logic and effects.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableJetpack
member.summary: If this is turned off, characters won't be able to use jetpacks at all.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableOxygen
member.summary: Enables oxygen processing. Oxygen is used by space suits and cockpits.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableOxygenPressurization
member.summary: Allows pressurization of ships and stations.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnablePlanets
member.summary: Enable/disable spawning of planets in world

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableRemoteBlockRemoval
member.summary: Enables players to remotely remove owned blocks to free up their PCU limit.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableRespawnShips
member.summary: Enables respawning in ships. If disabled, respawning is only possible in the suit, in medical stations, or in survival kits.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableSpiders
member.summary: Enables spawning of spiders on planets.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.TooltipWorldSettings_EnableSubGridDamage
member.summary: Enables damage to sub-grids originating from collisions, explosions and other sources on connected grids. We recommend leaving this setting disabled for more stable behavior.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableSunRotation
member.summary: Enables sun movement to create a day night cycle.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.TooltipWorldSettings_EnableTurrerFriendlyDamage
member.summary: Enables explosion damage from missiles being applied to its own grid.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableWolfs
member.summary: Enables spawning of wolves on planets.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_FloraDensity
member.summary: Density of flora elements on planets

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_InventorySize
member.summary: Adjusts the inventory size of your character.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_RespawnShipCooldown
member.summary: Sets the respawn ship cooldown multiplier.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_ScenarioEditMode
member.summary: Allows additional ingame options for creating scenario. Also displays your saved game in scenario start screen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_SpawnWithTools
member.summary: If this is turned off, characters won't spawn with any tools in their inventory.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_StartInRespawnScreen
member.summary: When played as scenario: player will start in respawn screen with new identity, all ownership will be lost

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_StationVoxelSupport
member.summary: By enabling this option grids will no longer turn dynamic when disconnected from static grids.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_ToolShake
member.summary: Enables shaking of ship drills and grinders.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.UnsavedChangesQuestion
member.summary: You have unsaved changes. Do you want to save current cutscene first?

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.WelcomeScreen_Text1
member.summary: I would first like to personally thank you for choosing to support our game and its development. Many talented people been involved in this project during the last six years and we are honoured to have you join our community.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.WelcomeScreen_Text2
member.summary: A space engineer is a professional practitioner who uses scientific knowledge, mathematics, physics, astronomy, propulsion technology, materials science, structural analysis, manufacturing, and ingenuity to solve practical problems in space and on planets. Space engineers take pride in their ability to get the job done right. No matter how big, how complex, or how remote.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.WelcomeScreen_Text3
member.summary: If you experience any issues, please do not hesitate to visit the support site or our Discord server where there are developers and many experienced players available to assist you! If you're interested in seeing some of the potential of Space Engineers, be sure to visit the {0} Community Hub. We look forward to seeing your creations and screenshots on there in the future. Good luck engineering your dreams!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.WorldSettings_WarningChangingWorldSize
member.summary: The selected world size is more limited than the original one. Reducing world size in an existing save could delete some ships beyond the new limit. Are you sure you want to continue?

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.WorldSettings_Error_NameExists
member.summary: The name you have entered already exists. Please change the name to something else.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.WorldSettings_Error_SavingFailed
member.summary: There was an error trying to rename your world. Please check your saves folder for any problems.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.WwwLinkNotAllowed
member.summary: This link is not allowed and will not open. Allowed sites: {0}community, youtube, KSH forum.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.WwwLinkNotAllowed_Steam
member.summary: This link is not allowed and will not open. Allowed sites: {0}community, youtube, KSH forum.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_HUD_Detail1
member.summary: Cycle through the various HUD states; they differ by amount of shown information. You can also change the way signals show up on your HUD.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_HUD_Detail2
member.summary: Press {CONTROL:TOGGLE_HUD} to cycle through HUD states.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_HUD_Detail3
member.summary: Press {CONTROL:TOGGLE_SIGNALS} to cycle through signal states.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Jetpack2_Detail1
member.summary: Turning off dampeners while flying allows you to move without slowing down when you let go of the input. This can be useful to move steady at low or high speeds without using much fuel.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Building_Detail1
member.summary: You can build blocks anywhere in the world or add them to existing grids. The toolbar config screen will show you all available blocks that you can build.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Building_Detail2
member.summary: Press {CONTROL:BUILD_SCREEN} to open toolbar config screen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Building_Detail3
member.summary: Drag a block to your toolbar.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Building_Detail4
member.summary: Select a block or tool by pressing 1 - 9

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Building_Detail2_Gamepad
member.summary: Press {CONTROL:TOOLBAR_RADIAL_MENU} to open the [Building Radial Menu].

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Building_Detail4_Gamepad
member.summary: Highlight a block with {GAMEPAD:AXIS_MOTION} and press {CONTROL:GUI:SHIFT_RIGHT} to select a block.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Building2_Detail1
member.summary: Most blocks come in two sizes and can be rotated in any direction.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Building2_Detail2
member.summary: Select the same block twice on your toolbar to pick a size.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Building2_Detail3
member.summary: Use {CONTROL:CUBE_ROTATE_ROLL_POSITIVE}, {CONTROL:CUBE_ROTATE_VERTICAL_NEGATIVE}, {CONTROL:CUBE_ROTATE_HORISONTAL_POSITIVE}, {CONTROL:CUBE_ROTATE_HORISONTAL_NEGATIVE}, {CONTROL:CUBE_ROTATE_ROLL_NEGATIVE} and {CONTROL:CUBE_ROTATE_VERTICAL_POSITIVE} keys to rotate blocks.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Building2_Detail4_Gamepad
member.summary: Use {CONTROL:BUILD:ROTATE_AXIS_LEFT} and {CONTROL:BUILD:ROTATE_AXIS_RIGHT} to rotate around the axis.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Building3_Detail1
member.summary: In survival mode you need the first component of a block to place it. You can produce components in assembler or salvage them from other blocks with a grinder.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Ownership_Detail1
member.summary: Blocks owned by other players cannot be accessed if they are not shared with others. You can hack blocks by replacing their computer parts with a grinder and welder to gain access.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_CameraTip_Detail1
member.summary: You will be building in no time!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_CameraTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Third person camera will switch to first person if there are objects in your way.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Power_Detail1
member.summary: Blocks or entire grids can be turned off to save power and fuel. When you are in a cockpit, Press {CONTROL:TOGGLE_REACTORS} to turn off and on the power production blocks.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_BuildingTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Blocks with a + symbol have variations available that you can scroll through.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_HUDTip_Detail1
member.summary: I could not have done it better myself!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_HUDTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* HUD signals can be individually disabled in your terminal control panel.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_IntroTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* You can ask me anything in the chat {CONTROL:CHAT_SCREEN} using ? <question> (english only). In case of any troubles contact us at support@keenswh.com

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_JetpackTip_Detail1
member.summary: That is my definition of flying!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_JetpackTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Use relative dampening with [Ctrl+]{0} to keep velocity of the ship under cursor.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_InventoryTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* You can drag items out of your inventory to drop them again.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Inventory_Detail1
member.summary: Highlighted objects can be picked up if there is room in your inventory.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Inventory_Detail2
member.summary: Press {CONTROL:USE} to pick up an item.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_EnergyTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Energy drains faster when it is hot or cold.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Energy_Detail1
member.summary: Your energy is getting low. Interact with a powered medical bay or survival kit to recharge your energy or use any kind of cockpit. Your tools need energy to function.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_HealthTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* You will also slowly heal in oxygenated environments.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Health_Detail1
member.summary: You're hurt. You can heal by interacting with the console of a powered medical bay or survival kit.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_HydrogenTip_Detail1
member.summary: I think you are smarter than my maker!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_HydrogenTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* You can conserve hydrogen when in space by flying with dampeners off.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Hydrogen_Detail1
member.summary: Your hydrogen is getting low. Hydrogen is produced from ice in a O2/H2 generator. You can refill bottles at the generator or resupply directly by interacting with a medical bay or survival kit if it's connected with the O2/H2 generator.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_MagneticBootsTip_Detail1
member.summary: The last Engineer took much longer to figure this out!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_MagneticBoots_Detail1
member.summary: In zero gravity you can use your magnetic boots to walk on any surface. Position yourself with your feet down and turn off your jetpack to automatically lock your magnetic boots.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_MagneticBoots_Detail2
member.summary: Use your magnetic boots in zero gravity.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_OxygenTip_Detail1
member.summary: Breathing is preferable to not breathing!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_OxygenTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Walking consumes less oxygen than running or sprinting

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Oxygen_Detail1
member.summary: Your oxygen is getting low. Oxygen is produced from ice in a O2/H2 generator. You can refill bottles at the generator or resupply directly by interacting with a medical bay or survival kit if it's connected with the O2/H2 generator.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_FlyingAShipTip_Detail1
member.summary: Pilots take no special joy in walking. Pilots like flying. - Neil Armstrong

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_FlyingAShipTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* You need thrusters in all six directions. More thrusters means faster acceleration!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_FlyingAShip_Detail1
member.summary: A ship requires thrusters for movement, gyroscopes to orientate, power and a cockpit. The controls for a ship are the same as the jetpack.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_FlyingAShip_Detail2
member.summary: Press {CONTROL:TOGGLE_REACTORS} to toggle power on or off.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_FlyingAShip_Detail3
member.summary: Use {CONTROL:JUMP} and {CONTROL:CROUCH} to go up and down.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Grinder_Detail1
member.summary: A grinder is used to deconstruct and salvage blocks by removing their components into your inventory.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Grinder_Detail2
member.summary: Hold {CONTROL:TOOLS:PRIMARY_TOOL_ACTION} to use grinder on any block.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_GrinderTip_Detail1
member.summary: You made quick work of that!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_GrinderTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Grinder's can be used to remove trees.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_HandDrill_Detail1
member.summary: A hand drill is used to break down rock, collect minerals or to dig tunnels. Ores can be found in asteroids and dark spots on planets. All drills are equipped with a short-range detector.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Rifle_Detail1
member.summary: A basic weapon to protect yourself; requires small calibre ammunition.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Rifle_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* There are more specialized rifles available. Don’t forget that you can review useful information anytime in the help screen by pressing {CONTROL:HELP_SCREEN}.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_WelderTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Use the {CONTROL:TOOLS:SECONDARY_TOOL_ACTION} to store components from your inventory into a block under construction.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Welder_Detail1
member.summary: A welder is used to construct and repair blocks by adding the required components from your inventory.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Welder_Detail2
member.summary: Hold {CONTROL:TOOLS:PRIMARY_TOOL_ACTION} to use the welder on any block.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_RefiningOre_Detail1
member.summary: Ore and scrap metal can be refined into ingots in a powered Refinery. Ingots can be used to produce components, tools and weapons. Refineries will automatically pull resources and refine them.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_RefiningOre_Detail2
member.summary: Use a survival kit or Refinery to process ore and obtain ingots.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_ComponentsTip_Detail1
member.summary: Your skills are quickly becoming superior to mine!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_ComponentsTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Blocks with a + symbol have variations available that you can scroll through.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Components_Detail1
member.summary: Components are used to build and repair blocks. You can use a welder on any block to add the required component. You can select tools and blocks on your toolbar.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_FlashlightTip_Detail1
member.summary: A little light goes a long way!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_FlashlightTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Remember, your flashlight consumes power from your suit.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Flashlight_Detail1
member.summary: Use your flashlight when entering dark areas.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Flashlight_Detail2
member.summary: Press {CONTROL:HEADLIGHTS} to toggle your flashlight off and on.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Ingots_Detail1
member.summary: Ingots can be used by a survival kit or assembler to produce components, tools and weapons. You can select what component to produce in the assembler's or survival kit's menu.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Ingots_Detail2
member.summary: Put iron ingot into Assembler inventory.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Ingots_Detail3
member.summary: Use a survival kit or Assembler to produce and obtain steel plates.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_InteractiveTip_Detail1
member.summary: These skills will serve you well!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_InteractiveTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Build control panels to easily access ship menus.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Interactive_Detail1
member.summary: Many blocks like doors, button panels, consoles, medical rooms, inventories and cockpits support various different actions.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Interactive_Detail2
member.summary: Press {CONTROL:USE} to activate a highlighted block.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Interactive_Detail3
member.summary: Press {CONTROL:TERMINAL} to go to menu of highlighted block.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Interactive_Detail4
member.summary: Press {CONTROL:INVENTORY} to open inventory of highlighted block.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_PowerTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Turn off blocks that you do not need to save power.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_PowerTip_Detail3
member.summary: *Tip:* Use [Ctrl+]{CONTROL:TOGGLE_REACTORS} to also turn off all connected grids.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ScreenBlueprintsRew_DeleteMessage
member.summary: Cannot rename blueprint because it is used by another process.

member.summary: " already exists. Do you want to replace it?

member.summary: Open already published blueprint/script in Workshop

member.summary: No content matches the selected filter.

member.summary: There are no subscribed Workshop blueprints. Open Workshop Browser to subscribe blueprints.

member.summary: There are no subscribed Workshop scripts. Open Workshop Browser to subscribe blueprints.

member.summary: Screenshot is already being taken at this moment

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ChatBotUnavailable
member.summary: I am sorry, I'm not available right now. Please visit https://support.keenswh.com/ or try again later.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ChatBot_Generic
member.summary: Hello, Engineer! I am Good.bot. What can I help you with?

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ChatBot_Rude
member.summary: That was not very nice! In case of any issues, please contact us at https://support.keenswh.com/

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ChatBotMisunderstanding0
member.summary: Apologies, I am unable to answer the question. I am still learning. For more help, please visit https://support.keenswh.com/

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Electricity
member.summary: Electricity can be produced through reactors or solar panels and stored in batteries. It is transferred automatically through all connected blocks. Many blocks require electricity to function.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Asteroids
member.summary: Asteroids can be found in space. How many there are depends on the server or world settings. Most asteroids will have ores that can be mined.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Gravity
member.summary: There is gravity on planets. Virtual Gravity can also be produced with the gravity generator block. Virtual gravity has no effect on grids unless virtual mass blocks are implemented.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Oxygen
member.summary: Some planets have breathable atmospheres. Oxygen can be produced from ice with a O2/H2 generator or from an oxygen farm. Oxygen can be stored in oxygen tanks and bottles.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Damage
member.summary: Damage can be inflicted by using weapons like missile launchers or gatling turrets or hand held rifles. Grids can also be damaged by impacts with other grids or voxels.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Repair
member.summary: Use your welder to repair damaged blocks. Blocks that have been completely destroyed need to be replaced or you can use a projector to repair faster.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Welding
member.summary: Use your welder on blocks to build and repair. Welding requires power drawn from your suit and components for the block. You can also install welders on ships. Use RMB to add missing components from the block you are looking at to your build planner.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Mining
member.summary: You can collect ore by using your drill on voxels like planets or asteroids. Your drill has a short-range detector that shows you the location of ores.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Healing
member.summary: You can heal yourself at a medical room or survival kit if you are injured. Hold {CONTROL:USE} to use the console.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Recharging
member.summary: You can recharge your suit power in medical rooms, survival kits or by sitting in any kind of seat or cockpit as long as it is powered.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Grinding
member.summary: You can use a grinder to grind down blocks and deconstruct them. Components are salvaged and transferred into your inventory while grinding.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Hydrogen
member.summary: Hydrogen is a fuel used for your suit's jetpack and hydrogen thrusters. Hydrogen is produced from ice in a O2/H2 generator. You can story hydrogen in hydrogen tanks and bottles.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Jetpack
member.summary: Your jetpack requires hydrogen. You can produce hydrogen from ice in a O2/H2 generator. Refill bottles at the generator or connect the generator with a medical room or survival kit to recharge your hydrogen directly.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_MagneticBoots
member.summary: Magnetic boots only work in zero gravity environments. They enable you to stick to surfaces like asteroids or ships. Press {CONTROL:THRUSTS} to disable your jetpack and enable your magnetic boots when in a standing position on a surface.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Ore
member.summary: Ore refers to several types of minerals that can be refined into ingots using a refinery. Ores can be found on planets and asteroids. Look for dark spots on planets to find ore.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Ice
member.summary: Ice is essential to produce oxygen and hydrogen and can be found on planets and inside asteroids.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Voxel
member.summary: Voxels are physical bodies such as asteroids or planets. Use your drill to bore into voxels and alter their shape. Use voxel hands in creative mode to create your own shapes.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Grid
member.summary: Grids are collections of blocks that shape stations or ships.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Visor
member.summary: Your visor can be opened and closed by pressing {CONTROL:HELMET}. Don't open your visor in space or you will suffocate!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_RoomPressure
member.summary: Room pressure is displayed in a vent menu. A room has to be sealed in order to pressurized.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Thrusters
member.summary: Thrusters allow your ships to move and fly. Make sure to use the right thrusters in the appropriate environments. Atmospheric thrusters will not work in space!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_ShipMovement
member.summary: Press {CONTROL:TOGGLE_REACTORS} to turn power off and on. If you are wondering if you have enough power, check if there is fuel in your reactors or if your batteries are charged.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_RoverMovement
member.summary: Press {CONTROL:LANDING_GEAR} to disable the brakes and landing gears or {CONTROL:TOGGLE_REACTORS} to turn the power off and on. You can check if there is fuel in your reactors or if your batteries are charged.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Planets
member.summary: Planets can be seen from any distance. If you do not see planets then they are likely not part of this world.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Pirates
member.summary: Protect yourself against pirates and other players by building armor, turrets and decoys.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Fuel
member.summary: Reactors use refined uranium ingots for fuel. Your jetpack and hydrogen thrusters require hydrogen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_PCU
member.summary: PCU stands for Performance Cost Unit. Building and removing blocks cost and refunds PCU.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Ownership
member.summary: You can own blocks when you are the one who added the computer components. You can choose to share your blocks with your faction or anybody else.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Factions
member.summary: Factions are a way to play with other players by sharing your blocks, which can be used by other players. Anyone can set up factions.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Bottles
member.summary: Hydrogen and oxygen bottles can be produced in assemblers and refilled in O2/H2 generators.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Help
member.summary: Press {CONTROL:HELP_SCREEN} to find additional help or just ask me.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_SaveBlueprints
member.summary: You can save ship designs in blueprints by aiming at them and press Ctrl-B. Press F10 to open your menu of blueprints.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Lost
member.summary: If you find yourself lost, you can always press {CONTROL:SUICIDE} to respawn at your nearest respawn point.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Mass
member.summary: Mass indicates the weight of your ship. Filling cargo containers with ores or components can severely impact the performance of your ship.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Skins
member.summary: Skins can be found in survival mode by finding the drop pods and activating their buttons. Use a medical room to customize your character.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_ShipInventories
member.summary: Be sure to connect individual inventories using conveyors. Some items are too large to pass through small conveyor tubes. Press {CONTROL:INVENTORY} to open your personal inventory.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_ShipBuilding
member.summary: The minimum requirements for a ship are a cockpit, gyroscope, one thruster in each direction and some form of power supply, such as a reactor or a battery.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Script
member.summary: Scripts might be disabled in world settings.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_GridMovement
member.summary: Make sure it has thrusters pointing in the direction it is moving and some source of power.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_StopMoving
member.summary: Be sure to enable your jetpack with {CONTROL:THRUSTS} and turn on your dampeners with {CONTROL:DAMPING}.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_RelativeDampeners
member.summary: Relative dampeners match your speed and direction with a moving target. Press [Ctrl-{CONTROL:DAMPING}] while looking at your target. You need to be within 100 meters for it to work.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_InertiaDampeners
member.summary: Inertia dampeners will slow movements when there is no input and can be toggled with {CONTROL:DAMPING}. Relative dampeners will match your speed with that of a moving object and can be toggled with [Ctrl-{CONTROL:DAMPING}]. Both need thrusters in all directions to work effectively

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Flashlight
member.summary: You can toggle your flashlight with {CONTROL:HEADLIGHTS}. Flashlights consume suit power and will not work when depleted.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_FindOtherPlayers
member.summary: Look for factions that allow anyone to join or ask around if you can group up with players. Look for antenna signals that could indicate other players.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_HowToPlayGame
member.summary: Can you be more specific, please?

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Thing
member.summary: Have you tried that other thing?

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_ShipWontFly
member.summary: Does your ship have enough power? Does it have enough thrusters? Are your dampeners turned on?

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_WhatIsABlock
member.summary: Blocks are what all ships and stations are made off. There are two sizes: large and small. You can find blocks in the menu by pressing {CONTROL:BUILD_SCREEN}.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_MirrorMode
member.summary: Mirror mode only works in creative mode and allows symmetric building. Press {CONTROL:SYMMETRY_SWITCH} to cycle through all six planes of mirrors. Use LMB button to confirm placement and RMB to remove one. Press {CONTROL:USE_SYMMETRY} to temporarily disable mirror mode.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_ProtectingMyself
member.summary: Hide your bases underground or inside asteroids. Build turrets and decoys to defend against attacks. Build hidden medical rooms and spread them out to maintain ways to respawn when attacked from inside you base.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_LosingHealth
member.summary: Are you suffocating? Standing in front of a thruster or perhaps you came too close to an active ship tool?

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_VoxelHands
member.summary: Voxel hands is a tool only available in creative mode, which allows you to add and sculpt voxel shapes. It can be enabled in world settings. press K to open voxel hand menu while equiped.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_AirTightnessPressure
member.summary: A room needs to be airtight before it can be filled with oxygen by an air vent. Make sure there are no holes exposed to space and that all doors are closed.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Components
member.summary: Components are required to construct blocks. They can be produced in assemblers from ingots. Placing a block in survival mode always requires the first component.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Station
member.summary: A station is a grid that is static and directly attached to voxels like planets or asteroids. Some stations can fly, but only have enough thrusters for basic movement.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Ship
member.summary: A ship is a grid that is designed to move. It has thrusters in each direction, a gyroscope for orientation, a cockpit and some source of power like batteries or reactors. Ships can be designed for specific tasks like building or fighting.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_CarRover
member.summary: A rover is a vehicle that uses wheels to move instead of thrusters, which are used to fly. Rovers are usually cheap to build, but often slow and an easy target for other players.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_GPSSignals
member.summary: GPS signals can be disabled or created in the Coms tab. Double-click a GPS signal to disable it. GPS signals can be stored in LCD panels or broadcasted in chat. Be careful not to attract enemies.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_GridSize
member.summary: There are 2 grid sizes available that are simply referred to as small and large. You can switch the grid size of a block by reselecting the same block on your toolbar. Not all blocks are available in both grid sizes.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Suit
member.summary: Your suit keeps you alive when you are in space. Your health, hydrogen, oxygen and power supplies are displayed on your HUD. Your suit is equipped with magnetic boots to walk in space and a jetpack to fly.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_HandTools
member.summary: There are 3 hand tools. A welder builds and repairs. A grinder salvages and deconstructs, while a drill is used to find ore, collect ore and dig tunnels.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Inventory
member.summary: Your inventory can be accessed by pressing {CONTROL:INVENTORY}. Drag items outside of your inventory screen to drop them. Pick up items by pressing {CONTROL:PICK_UP}.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_ShipToolsWeapons
member.summary: Tools can be added to your toolbars by pressing {CONTROL:BUILD_SCREEN}. Drag and drop or right-click tools to automatically add them to your toolbar. This works the same for ship functions when you are inside a cockpit.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Ingots
member.summary: Ingots are produced in refineries from ores and are essential to produce components.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Armor
member.summary: Armor is used to design the structure of ships and stations, and acts as protection for important blocks. Light armor is cheap and enables ships to be fast. Heavy armor offers more protection for ships, but it affects these vehicles' speed.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Meteor
member.summary: Meteors can be enabled in world settings. You can protect yourself against meteors by building gatling turrets, adding layers of armor to vehicles and buildings or by simply hiding inside structures.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_UnknownSignals
member.summary: Signals indicate positions of pods where you can obtain loot and skins in survival mode. Weak signals are only visible for you. Stronger signals are visible for everyone on the server but may lead to better loot.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_GPSColors
member.summary: Blue Signals are owned by you. White signals are owned by a friendly faction. Red signals are owned by a hostile faction. Green and yellow signals indicate loot pods.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Drones
member.summary: Drones are small unmanned ships that can either be remote controlled, script controlled or sometimes controlled by sensors and timer blocks.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Objective
member.summary: Space Engineers is a sandbox game. You can set your own goals. Search the workshop for scenarios and missions or create your own to play together with friends! Active mission objectives are displayed in the top left corner.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_GoodBot
member.summary: I am Good.bot. I am here to answer your questions to the best of my ability. How can I help you?

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Math
member.summary: Math! I do that all the time!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Begin
member.summary: Get your production up and running. Build refineries and assemblers. Make sure you have enough power, Build solar panels, batteries and reactors. make sure your medical room is well protected and build more to be sure!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_BasicMovement
member.summary: Use {CONTROL:FORWARD} {CONTROL:STRAFE_LEFT} {CONTROL:BACKWARD} {CONTROL:STRAFE_RIGHT} to move, Hold {CONTROL:SPRINT} to sprint, Toggle {CONTROL:SWITCH_WALK} to walk. Use {CONTROL:CROUCH} to crouch and {CONTROL:JUMP} to jump.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Time
member.summary: It is time for Space Engineers!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_SteamWorkshop
member.summary: The {0} workshop is where you can find all player made blueprints, scenarios, scripts and mods that players published. Subscribe to workshop items to access them in game.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Painting
member.summary: While holding a block, you can paint blocks with {CONTROL:CUBE_COLOR_CHANGE}. Press K to access more colour options. Use Ctrl-{CONTROL:CUBE_COLOR_CHANGE} or Shift-{CONTROL:CUBE_COLOR_CHANGE} to paint large surfaces.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_InvalidMaterial
member.summary: Sorry, That material does not exist in Space Engineers.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Broadcasting
member.summary: Your suit has a limited range antenna for accessing grids remotely or controlling drones. You can turn it off and on with O.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_BlockRotation
member.summary: You can turn on the block and grid rotations assist in the game options menu to see the rotation controls. Press {CONTROL:CUBE_DEFAULT_MOUNTPOINT} to rotate a block towards its default mount-point.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_HUD
member.summary: You can switch between HUD states with {CONTROL:TOGGLE_HUD}. Toggle {CONTROL:TOGGLE_SIGNALS} to switch between modes for GPS signals.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Bug
member.summary: You can report bugs and problems with the game at the forums or visit https://support.keenswh.com/

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Messages
member.summary: You can send private messages to other players or factions through the Coms tab in your inventory. These messages can only be send if your antenna is enabled and in range of other players or antennas.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_AutoPilot
member.summary: To use autopilot your ship first needs a Remote Control block. You need to add custom GPS waypoints in the Remote Control Block and select a flight mode. You can also set actions to happen when the ship arrives at the next waypoint.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Experimental
member.summary: Experimental mode is a setting that enables features that are considered unstable and can possibly cause performance issues. Experimental mode can be enabled in game settings.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Marek
member.summary: Marek Rosa is the Founder and CEO of Keen Software House and GoodAI.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_GoodAI
member.summary: GoodAI was founded by CEO/CTO Marek Rosa in January 2014 and performs research on the development of artificial intelligence.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_DisableHints
member.summary: To disable Good.bot hints, press Escape, go to Options, go to Game and disable "Show Good.bot hints".

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Permissions
member.summary: In multiplayer you need special permissions from an admin to be able to spawn blueprints, edit scripts or teleport. In single player you can turn on space master or change the world mode to creative.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_LeavePlanet
member.summary: To leave a planet with an atmosphere you need a ship capable of going into space. The best way is to equip your ship with hydrogen thrusters and hydrogen tanks.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Groups
member.summary: You can use block functions of multiple blocks simultaneously by using block groups. Use Ctrl or Shift to select the ship blocks you wish to put into a group; enter a name in "Block group" on the right side of the screen and press Enter to create the block group.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_MergeGrids
member.summary: You can connect grids with each other with landing gears or connectors. You can merge two grids of the same size type together permanently by using merge blocks or even rotors.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Camera
member.summary: You can change your perspective with {CONTROL:CAMERA_MODE} from first person mode to third person mode. Note that third person camera can clip back to first person if objects are obstructing the view.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Ammo
member.summary: You can create ammunition for your weapons and turrets in the advanced assembler if you have the right materials available.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Airlock
member.summary: An airlock permits the player to move freely in and out while keeping the interior pressurized. The easiest way to achieve this is by building a set of parallel doors but can be made much more advanced with air vents, timer blocks, button panels or scripts.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Pushing
member.summary: Player characters can push small grids by walking or flying into them if these grids aren't too heavy. If you want to push or pull heavy objects you will have to build a ship or rover and grab the object with landing gear.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Upgrade
member.summary: You can assemble better tools in the assembler. You can also upgrade the refinery and assembler by adding upgrade modules to make them faster, more efficient or less power consuming.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_GameMode
member.summary: There are two game modes: survival and creative. In creative mode you won't need any materials to build your ships. You can change this game mode by selecting your world in your saves menu and change the settings.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_ScreenShot
member.summary: You can make screenshots by pressing F12 by default. Or if you have Nvidia Ansel you can press Alt-F to enter capture mode.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Unlock
member.summary: You can unlock new blocks by fully constructing other required blocks. You can see what blocks will unlock the next block by viewing them in the G screen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Temperature
member.summary: Temperature affects your suit systems and will drain your power faster in extreme conditions. Without power your suit will no longer protect you against extreme conditions and you may start taking damage.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_SpawnShip
member.summary: Your spawn ship will have everything you need to get started. A survival kit, power and a O2/H2 generator for oxygen and hydrogen. You can take nonesential parts of your ship to use for your new base and scrap it entirely once you no longer need it.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_MetalScrap
member.summary: Metal scrap appears when blocks are violently destroyed and can be melted back into iron ingots by putting them into a refinery.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_LogOut
member.summary: You can use a cryo room to store your character before leaving the server. This will prevent your character from dying after some time and losing your toolbar. Make sure the room is supplied with oxygen and power.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Interaction
member.summary: Interactive objects like doors, cockpits and button panels are highlighted yellow and can be entered or interacted with by pressing {CONTROL:USE}.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Navigation
member.summary: You can create GPS signals to store important locations and waypoints. Use an antenna or beacon to broadcast positions of grids, but be careful, as others can also see these marked locations. Use /GPS to quickly save your current location.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_CopyPaste
member.summary: You can copy, paste and delete blocks and grids only in creative mode by pressing Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V and Ctrl-X.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Tools
member.summary: A welder to construct blocks, a grinder to deconstruct blocks and a drill to find ore and dig tunnels. All tools can be produced in assemblers or survival kits from basic materials.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Commands
member.summary: Use /help to find all chat commands.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Platinum
member.summary: Platinum is a rare material only found in asteroids and moons. There is no platinum on planets.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Uranium
member.summary: Uranium is a rare material only found in asteroids and moons. There is no uranium on planets.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Stone
member.summary: Stone can be refined into small amounts of basic minerals like Iron, Silicon and Nickel in refineries or a survival kit.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_BlockShapes
member.summary: You can access alternative block shapes if you have a block equipped on your toolbar with an + symbol. Use the scroll wheel to switch to different shapes.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_BuildMode
member.summary: You can toggle different building modes by pressing B.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_CarJump
member.summary: Your car can use its suspensions to jump to get out of tight spaces. Hold and release X to charge the jump of your car. The strength of the jump is based on your suspensions strength setting.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_ConvertGrid
member.summary: You can convert grids from station to ship or ship into station in a grid's info screen if this is enabled in the world settings.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_FlipRover
member.summary: You can flip your rover by adding pistons and pushing itself up or you can try adding heavy blocks like batteries to your grid, so that it will fall over by changing its center of mass.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Tutorial
member.summary: Play "Learning to Survive" to learn about the basics of Space Engineers. Pay attention to the tooltips for blocks to learn about their functions and I will do my best to help you along the way!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Encounter
member.summary: Random encounters are shipwrecks, derelict vessels and pirate stations that can be found in space. They often broadcast a MAYDAY signal. Careful, exploring these encounters can be dangerous.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Blastdoors
member.summary: Blast door blocks are armor blocks that won't bend and fit in between layers of blocks, so they can move freely by rotors or pistons. They are useful to create large moving doors and platforms.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_BlockLimit
member.summary: Block limits sets a limit to how many of each type of block each player can build to ensure server performance. Block limits can be disabled in the world settings.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Hacking
member.summary: Hacking a block can be done by using a grinder to remove the computer components from a block and placing them back with a welder to gain access to the block.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Ladder
member.summary: You can use ladders to traverse vertical spaces. Ladders can be stacked vertically. Press {CONTROL:USE} to interact with a ladder. Hold {CONTROL:FORWARD} or {CONTROL:BACKWARD} to go up and down. Press {CONTROL:JUMP} to get off the ladder.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Decoratives
member.summary: Decorative blocks allow players to decorate the interiors of large grid ships. Blocks such as the desk and kitchen are modular and can be combined together to create many shapes.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_IndustrialCockpit
member.summary: The industrial cockpit is a sturdy decorative cockpit for large and small grids that features a large field of vision. This cockpit is useful for rovers and ships that need to work close to surfaces or other grids without damaging them.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_ConsoleBlock
member.summary: The console block is a decorative block with the ability to project large and small grids scaled down.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Emotes
member.summary: Emotes are character animations that can be equipped on your toolbar from the G-screen or played by opening chat and entering / followed by the name of the emote you wish to play. for example: /EmoteName

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_BuildPlanner
member.summary: The build planner helps you to quickly access the components required to build blocks. Use your welders RMB function to add a block to your component list. Use the withdraw button from any inventories to automatically collect the required components if available and accessible.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_StylePack
member.summary: The Style Pack ads more player skins, armor skins and emotes for you to use in game.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_ArmorSkins
member.summary: Armor skins are different textures and patterns for your ships and stations. They can be applied the same way you paint grids. Press P to open the paint screen.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_NPCShip
member.summary: There are cargo ships that travel the world around you. Coming near them can be dangerous as they consider you a threat.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_CooperativeMode
member.summary: Cooperative mode will let assemblers automatically take a portion of the queue of another assembler, making them work together.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_SpectatorMode
member.summary: You can access Spectator mode by pressing F8 to move around your camera freely and F7 to remain in the spectator camera while controlling your character. Spectator mode requires permissions and has to enabled in worlds settings.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Objective_Q4
member.summary: What do I have to do

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Bug_Q0
member.summary: How do I report a bug

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Description_FAQ_Bug_Q5
member.summary: Where can I report a bug

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_BuildingTip2_Detail1
member.summary: Are you sure you have not done this before?

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_BuildingTip2_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Always make sure you keep a few components with you.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_FlyingAShipLGTip_Detail1
member.summary: One Engineer told me that flying a ship is as easy as riding a bike!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_FlyingAShipLGTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Landing gears can be used to pick up other grids and move them around.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_FlyingAShipLG_Detail1
member.summary: This ship is equipped with magnetic landing gears. Toggling landing gears will temporarily disable their magnetic lock.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_FlyingAShipLG_Detail2
member.summary: Use {CONTROL:LANDING_GEAR} to toggle the landing gear.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_WheeledVehicles2_Detail1
member.summary: You can adjust wheel settings individually to control steering angles, acceleration, maximum speed and much more. They can “jump” by charging their suspension to get out of gaps.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_WheeledVehicles2_Detail2
member.summary: Hold and release {CONTROL:THRUSTS} to charge a jump.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_WheeledVehiclesTip_Detail1
member.summary: Congratulations! You just passed your driving test!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_WheeledVehiclesTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Be careful not to go too fast with Wheeled Vehicles, which can flip over easily.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_WheeledVehicles_Detail1
member.summary: Wheeled Vehicles are cheap to build and require little power.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_WheeledVehicles_Detail2
member.summary: Toggle {CONTROL:TOGGLE_REACTORS} to turn power off and on.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_OwnershipTip_Detail1
member.summary: To hack or not to hack? That is the real question!

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_OwnershipTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* You can configure ownership to share it with friends. Remember, you can find additional information anytime in the help screen by pressing {CONTROL:HELP_SCREEN}.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_HelmetVisorTip_Detail1
member.summary: Being able to breathe makes working a little easier.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_HelmetVisorTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Always make sure your visor is closed before going into space. All of this useful information can always be accessed in the help screen by pressing {CONTROL:HELP_SCREEN}.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_HelmetVisor_Detail1
member.summary: Your helmet visor is still open! Close it to avoid taking damage in low oxygen environments.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_HelmetVisor_Detail2
member.summary: Use {CONTROL:HELMET} to open and close your visor.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_StuckTip_Detail1
member.summary: Excellent! Now you can continue your training.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_StuckTip_Detail2
member.summary: *Tip:* Always make sure your vehicle has enough fuel before leaving your base.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Stuck_Detail2
member.summary: Press {0} to toggle power on and off.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Stuck_Detail3
member.summary: Press {0} to toggle landing gears, brakes and connectors.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_IntroTip2_Detail1
member.summary: *Tip:* You can enable/disable Good.bot ingame help or control hints in Game-Options.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.NotificationJumpAbortedAlreadyJumping
member.summary: Jump was aborted, connected grid is already jumping.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.NotificationJumpAbortedLocked
member.summary: Jump was aborted, the grid is locked.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.NotificationJumpAbortedNoLocation
member.summary: Jump was aborted, no suitable target location found.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.NotificationJumpAbortedShortDistance
member.summary: Jump was aborted, distance too short.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.NotificationJumpAbortedStatic
member.summary: Jump was aborted, the grid is static.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.MedicalRoom_SpawnNameToolTip
member.summary: The name to display on the spawn screen. Leave empty to display the block name.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.SurvivalKit_SpawnNameToolTip
member.summary: The name to display on the spawn screen. Leave empty to display the block name.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.Antenna_HudTextToolTip
member.summary: The text to display on the HUD when the antenna is enabled. Leave empty to display the block name.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.BlockPropertiesTitle_HudText_Tooltip
member.summary: The text to display on the HUD when the beacon is enabled. Leave empty to display the block name.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableResearch
member.summary: Enables advancement through the progression tree.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.NotificationBlockNotResearched
member.summary: Unknown technology. You have to research it first.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Pod1_Detail1
member.summary: You start in small drop pod containing the most important accessories. The pod is equipped with an O2/H2 generator to produce hydrogen and oxygen and a survival kit for health and energy.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Pod2_Detail1
member.summary: The survival kit, if powered, will let you respawn, regenerate your health and energy and is capable of producing small amounts of ingots from stone that you can then produce into components.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Pod3_Detail1
member.summary: The first thing to do is to gather stone using your hand drill. Equip your drill, find some stone and store it in the survival kit on the back of your pod. Then access the production tab of your pod and produce ingots.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ScreenDebugAdminMenu_KeepOriginalOwnershipOnPasteTip
member.summary: When grid is pasted keep original ownership and authorship.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.TerminalTab_Factions_ShareProgressToolTip
member.summary: Share your block unlock progress with selected member.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Turbine2_Detail1
member.summary: Your base will require more power as you add more functional blocks. Be sure to build more wind turbines or solar panels or turn blocks off to prevent them from consuming power.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Turbine_Detail1
member.summary: A solar panel or wind turbine under the right conditions will be able to provide enough energy for you to get started. Continue by adding a basic assembler or deconstruct your old survival kit and move it over to your new base.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_BasicRefinery_Detail1
member.summary: A basic assembler or basic refinery is more efficient at producing and refining then the survival kit but also requires more power. Build a battery to use your power more efficiently.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Battery2_Detail1
member.summary: You can find ores by looking for dark or bright spots on the ground. Equip your drill to scan for nearby ores or build scouting vehicles with ore detectors to move large amounts of ore to your base.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Battery_Detail1
member.summary: Your base is shaping up! Now that you have a battery you can start expanding your base even more. Try to find ores to increase your production significantly.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.IngameHelp_Temperature_Detail1
member.summary: Temperature affects how quickly your suit energy drains. Hot or cold temperatures will hurt you when your suit is out of power. Tip: Pressurized environments will always maintain optimal temperatures.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.RespawnScreeenHelpTextSpaceSpawn
member.summary: You will spawn near other players in space.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.RespawnScreeenHelpTextSpawn
member.summary: You will spawn near other players on the planet or the moon.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ToolTipWorldSettings_BlocksInventorySize
member.summary: Adjusts the inventory size of blocks like cargo containers, production blocks, and similar.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_Tutorial_0
member.summary: How to use the Replay Tool:

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_Tutorial_1
member.summary: 1. Add as many characters as you need, then position them how you want them and save the world.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_Tutorial_2
member.summary: 2. Switch to the character you wish to control using F6.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_Tutorial_3
member.summary: 3. Click 'Record + Replay', and move the character as you wish.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_Tutorial_5
member.summary: 5. Reload the world, do not save!.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_Tutorial_7
member.summary: If you wish to clear the recorded data, press Delete Recordings to start over.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_Tutorial_8
member.summary: If you wish to observe the recorded data, press 'Replay' and watch as the game replays the data.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_Tutorial_9
member.summary: If you wish to store the recorded data, reload the world, then save the game. Then, it will carry over to other sessions.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_Tutorial
member.summary: How to use the Replay Tool: 1. Add as many characters as you need, then position them how you want them and save the world. 2. Switch to the character you wish to control using F6. 3. Click 'Record + Replay', and move the character as you wish. 4. Press escape to stop recording. 5. Reload the world, do not save!. 6. Repeat from step 2. If you wish to clear the recorded data, press Delete Recordings to start over. If you wish to observe the recorded data, press 'Replay' and watch as the game replays the data. If you wish to store the recorded data, reload the world, then save the game. Then, it will carry over to other sessions.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Game.Localization.MySpaceTexts.SimpleNewGame_Frostbite_Description
member.summary: You are a member of a salvage crew, which has been tasked by a mysterious client to acquire something extremely valuable (yet unknown) on Triton. Play solo or with up to four players; explore this moon’s frigid landscape and remarkable architecture, and overcome numerous engineering challenges as you uncover this world’s secrets.
